messageBody:
Hi Todd,

You were right, it was related to NetBeans (or maybe something
else...who knows)

Instead of writing and isolated ant file for compiling the tests as
you suggested I searched for the xml file which contains the output of
the test results after running. XML file with the output should look
something like this (just in case somebody else steps into the same
error and need to search for it):

<testsuite errors="xxx" failures="xxx" name="xxx" tests="xxx" time="xxx">
<properties>
<property/>
</properties>
<testcase>...</testcase>
<testcase>...</testcase>
<testcase>...</testcase>
</testsuite>

Results on the XML seems to be more accurate and detailed than the
ones I got through NetBeans.

Thanks for your care and advice,

Diego

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bradley, Todd" <todd.bradley@...> wrote:
>
> Hi, Diego. From your description, it sounds to me like the issue is
> related to NetBeans' JUnit test runner. I've never used NetBeans, so I
> don't have any specific advice. Can you try running your tests from
> ant, using <junit> and <junit report>? If that gives the test results
> you're expecting then, that would tell us that it's a NetBeans thing.
> Everything you wrote in your email looks fine to me
>
>
> Todd.
